comment: Hmmm...  Indeed I am so torn about this establishment.  Anything grilled on a stick, would be delicious, right?  Anyways, Kushimama Tokyo Yakitori has potential to grow in my books, provided if they can rectify the following :*  If possible, do grill the food on the stick TO ORDER.  Aka, I prefer my food on the stick to be pipping hot and have grilled marks on it.  What I received was premade, lukewarm and not so appealing... aka NOT so appetizing.*  Have more options for Yakitori items.  Do think outside the box.  Why follow the same old same old route??  Be innovative??  AKA Creative??  Is it too much to ask??YES you are a fast casual dining option kiosk/vendor whereby your sister or sibling company is next to you.  If I am NOT mistaken I ordered one of the Lunch Bento set or something.  It comes with 2 Sticks of Chicken Thighs, 1 Stick of Chicken Meatball, 1 Stick of Cheesy Chicken Sausage.  My order comes with Rice, Salad and "Crumpies".  Though Lunch was (SG$5.00).  I guess I cannot complain about the "Quality" Food??Thankfully Kushimama Tokyo Yakitori is HALAL Certified by MUIS.  That alone give you 1 star in my books.  In terms of flavor of the food on the stick.  Unfortunately, most are "drenched" with soya sauce...  Or at least the meal I purchased was drenched with soya sauce.  ALL the items for my Lunch are "Chicken"..  **SIGH**  Care to innovate or care to create more appetizing sauce or give more options for patrons to choose etc.Oh well.  Maybe it a fluke.  Maybe its their OFF DAY, but I may return and perhaps see how things will be.  I am indeed craving for Halal Certified Yakitori else, I just have to create it at home??My apologies for this rant.  **SAD FACE INDEED**Kushimama Tokyo Yakitori1 Tampines Walk,#B1-53A, Our Tampines HubSingapore 528523Tel : +65 69093938

rest_name: Enak Enak Hong Kong Tea House
address: 342 Bedok Road Simpang Bedok Singapore 469524 Singapore
comment: This is a review of lunch with a colleague at Enak Enak Honk Kong Tea House.We were quickly pointed to a seat.  They have a very airy outdoor seating area.  It was also very clean.  Even though it was pretty much right at noon, the temperature was still quite comfortable.  Gotta love the wall-mounted fans.  They created a very nice breeze.tinyurl.com/bsckahrThe staff was quite friendly and professional.  They quickly brought us menus and, soon after, took our orders.The menu is quite extensive with both eastern and western options.  Actually, it is a very global menu.My colleague selected the XO Fried Rice with beef.  I went for the Chicken Baguette Sandwich.I also ordered the jumbo lime juice.   That was fantastic.  I love lime juice.  I love a jumbo one even more.  You can super-size my lime juice anytime.tinyurl.com/dxoeh6jChicken Baguette Sandwich - This was a very good sandwich.  For one, it was quite large.  The baguette had that nice crispy outer edge like one expects from a French baguette and it also had the expected soft centre.  The chicken was tender and flavourful.  The veggies were all fresh and crisp.  I thought the tomatoes and cucumbers were a good match for  the chicken.  It came together very well.tinyurl.com/bpmoxyaCheese Fries - The fries themselves were pretty basic.  But the cheese added some nice flavour.  I certainly enjoyed them.tinyurl.com/bozuf5mXO Fried Rice with beef - My colleague had the XO Fried Rice with beef.  He seemed to like it.  It looked very appetizing.tinyurl.com/cv9gqkbReceipt (18.80)tinyurl.com/d8jfqsgOverall - I would have no problem going back.  Good food, generous portions, friendly staff, and comfortable clean surroundings all make a for a nice lunch spot.  The kitchen was also very clean.  For me, at less than $10 per person, I thought it was a good value.

rest_name: Enak Enak Hong Kong Tea House
address: 342 Bedok Road Simpang Bedok Singapore 469524 Singapore
comment: I've been here yesterday night. It was super crowded. Decided to give black hokkien mee a try since I had fallen in love with the KL one and my hubby ordered Fried bee hoon.The black hokkien mee turned out a bit disappointed, kinda bitter due to too much black sauce I guess? Anyway it cost $5.5And you know what, the fried bee hoon cost $11 which surprised my hubby haha. It was filled with 4 peeled-prawns and a few slices of fish. The taste was normal.Maybe next time I should try others' advice for the signature dish at this eatery.

rest_name: Enak Enak Hong Kong Tea House
address: 342 Bedok Road Simpang Bedok Singapore 469524 Singapore
comment: Along the stretch of alfresco halal eateries at Simpang Bedok, you will find Enak Enak HongKong Tea House. Like all the other halal eateries surrounding it, Enak Enak has 2 separate sitting areas - inside and outside. Unlike its neighbors, however, they serve Dim Sum and other local delicacies like Char Kway Teow and Orh Lua (Fried Oyster Omelette). It gets more crowded here at night, during dinner and suppertime. Although they serve your basic Dim Sum dishes like Siew Mai, Har Gao and Xiao Long Bao, this is not a place you want to head to if you are picky about the quality or authencity of your Dim Sum. Their Dim Sum just does not seem to be on par with restaurants that specialize in Dim Sum. What you can order though, are the Paper Thosai and Oyster Omelette. The Oyster Omelette here is fried till crispy, and the oysters seem fresh enough. The Paper Thosai is crispy on the outside, and warm and fluffy on the inside. Accompanied with its curry and chutney sauces, the thosai was savory and enjoyable.

rest_name: Enak Enak Hong Kong Tea House
address: 342 Bedok Road Simpang Bedok Singapore 469524 Singapore
comment: Very fast and efficient service. Bright and cheery, this place has a lively vibe. I like coming here for supper when I have to work late.

rest_name: Enak Enak Hong Kong Tea House
address: 342 Bedok Road Simpang Bedok Singapore 469524 Singapore
comment: Had supper here at 1am with friends, and was pleasantly surprised to find out that this place opens till 6am everyday! Yet another supper place willing to accommodate the nocturnal; a welcoming, loud place filled with junk food. Was further pleased by the food: we had Piain (pattaya Maggie goreng, $4 each), Fresh Milk with Wheatgrass ($2.80) and Lemongrass Tea ($1.80) (apparently the two most popular drinks here), Tea HK, and half a Spring Chicken. Our bill amounted to $24.50, but it was well worth the amount as we thoroughly enjoyed suppering there. Our maggie gorengs were tasty, albeit spicy due to the pepper, which almost brought about our deaths as we usually do not have much ability stomaching spicy food. The drinks were really good at putting out the fire in our mouths, and I daresay we would go back again despite our poor ability to eat spicy food, as this place is really perfect for the night prowlers who need all the junk in the world to fuel their zombi-fied states.

The chicken is very flavourful. Breast is slightly dry. For me, mild is already very spicy. The bottomless drink isn't really bottomless because the waitress has to be told to come and help refill. Because of the spiciness, I drank two glasses before my meal ends.The wedges and the fries are crispy on the outside, soft on the inside.

I wasn't going to say anything, but this nando's messed up my order not once but twice, costing me all the 'chili's' (loyalty program) I had saved up (what's worse, I never actually got the chicken!). When I wrote in on Facebook to claim, they told me that would contact me, but I never actually received recourse. I wouldn't go back! Disappointed since I had really grown to love the brand (used to frequent the star vista outlet a lot.

Honest rip off. Was hoping for a wholesome salad, but this was seriously pathetic! And expensive too. It cost me $17.80. And beyond it being subpar, it had hardly anything in it! Just lettuce, chicken and measly croutons... to add, the lettuce was wet when they served it. And the dressing was white and it looked coagulated which is seriously not even appetizing to look at... I should have gone elsewhere and paid the same amount for a salad that was 10 times better!

rest_name: Big Ben’s Place - Great British Pies
comment: I normally don't like meat and pastry. Doesn't seem to match very well. But Big Ben's pies is an exception for me. Well, firstly, their store is really nice British themed cafe. Even from outside, it looks nicely designed. Now, to the main item: the pies. I like their black pepper chicken and blueberry pie. Now, I still do not really like pies, but I'm a fan of big ben's pies. The inside of the black pepper chicken is creamy and not overdone with pepper. The crust is pretty well done as well. Next, the blueberry pies are great stuff. But then again, I'm a sucker for fruit pies. Overall I'm satisfied for the total price of ~$6.

rest_name: Big Ben’s Place - Great British Pies
comment: It took me a really, really long walk (getting a little lost in between) before I found this place. Big Ben's Place is pretty quaintly located within a private house estate so I guess they serve the people living around the area well. First off, the pies here are not your typical ones. The pastry is more crumbly, taking on a shortbread variety as opposed to the flakier ones you might be used to. The filling seems to be a thickened version of chicken cream soup and this paired nicely with the crumby exterior - almost like dipping shortbread into soup.I'm not too sure how authentic British pies should be like but this is not too bad. I reckon a drive in to this spot will make a better decision then trying to walk in.

rest_name: Big Ben’s Place - Great British Pies
comment: As their name suggests, Big Ben's Pies is indubitably English. Try their 9-windowed sturdy wooden door on for size. For those who've been to Great Britain, this place will be like stepping into a pie shop off Carnaby Street while those who haven't, saved on their airfares.What makes their pies so much more special is that they have the right amount of crumble and firmness in their crusts, and the filling in their Steak and Mushroom pie ($3.50) is sublime and their succulent hunks of beef ooze with flavour that's enhanced from a stew with taut button mushrooms and thyme. Chicken and Mushroom ($3.50) fans will not be disappointed with Big Ben's own take on Singapore (and Britain's!) most popular pie,(why?) though the wateriness of their filling might be a hit or miss for some.

address: 6 Changi Business Park Avenue 1 #01-28 UE Bizhub East Singapore 486017 Singapore
comment: This is a review of the lunch buffet at the newly opened Kinara Contemporary  Indian Cuisine at Changi Business Park.Along with a colleague, we decided to wander over and check out the new restaurants that have been popping up in the UE Bizhub East.We decided on Kinara. The room is a combination of classic and modern.  It is not overly ornate.  Oddly enough, there was a TV showing some relatively provocative Indian music videos.The staff was very friendly.  They quickly greeted us and pointed us towards a table.  We chose to have the buffet.All of the food on the buffet looked very appetizing.tinyurl.com/cz7gn3eMy favorites were the butter chicken and the chicken tandoori drumsticks.  There was  a vegetarian dish that was quite spicy and I really enjoyed that.  The onion bhaji (or it may have technically been a pakora) was also quite nice.  It was crispy goodness.  Actually, everything on my plate was delicious.  It isn't the same as cooked to order Indian food but, for a buffet, they were pretty much hitting it out of the park on taste.One negative is there were no samosas available on the buffet.  For me, that is heartbreaking.  Another negative was the food from the buffet was not very hot.  They need to increase the temperature of the food warmers.My plate:tinyurl.com/bq78tcwA big plus is they brought us a big plate of very fresh galric naan to share.  tinyurl.com/bwcbor8For the two of us, it came to around $35 .  So, this is not a budget lunch.  I thought it was well worth it though.Overall, Kinara is a welcome addition to the lineup of lunch places in the Changi Business Park area.  We both thought it was a little better than the other nearby Indian buffet.  The staff was very friendly.  The space is comfortable.  The food on the buffet looks good and tastes good too.

address: 6 Changi Business Park Avenue 1 #01-28 UE Bizhub East Singapore 486017 Singapore
comment: Located in the Changi Business Park, close to work, this little spot had a tasty lunch buffet.Good price, conveniently located, and good tasting food.

address: 6 Changi Business Park Avenue 1 #01-28 UE Bizhub East Singapore 486017 Singapore
comment: Very good food, much better than some other options in the area. I had the lamb korma with cheese naan, no complaints here and the service was fine.

Can you keep a secret? This is the best laksa in the east.I don't care about the laksa wars in Katong. They range from insipid to quite okay, but none of it is truly awesome (even 328 Laksa, which I regard as the best in Katong along that stretch). So the origin story of the Katong laksa we love came from a guy they called Janggut. Which is kinda gross if you know what a janggut is. So Mr Janggut is no longer alive but the elderly couple who sell the laksa here at this spot in Bedok (which is behind the Bedok SPC station, near the swimming complex by the way), learned the recipe from him. So in a sense it is the original and truest Katong laksa that still exists.Like anything run by old people I worry that it will disappear when they get older. So I make it a point to eat here every time I come to the east, and you should too. It's soooooper. Super duper.

Kungfu Paradise is a haven for young food lovers. This East-Meets-West café may seem intimidating at first glance with its swanky-looking interior but is in fact easy on the pocket, and during their indefinite lunch special on weekdays (11am - 2.30pm), bargain hunters get to enjoy Kungfu Paradise's bestsellers at a promotional price of $6.80 (wow!) What's great is that they stay open until the wee hours of the morning (3.15 am on some days!).And let's get into the food. The rest of the menu pales in comparison - your usual fried foods with generic sauces, but there are a few delicious standouts. Their attempt at combining East-and-West is quite commendable. Their French Toast with Chicken Floss and Condensed Milk ($5.80) is quite the experience, and the highlight here has to be the Flaming Crab Pasta ($10.80). Spicy, delicious crabmeat sauce on pasta... wow!

address: 2 Tampines Central 5 #B1-10/11 Century Square Singapore 529509 Singapore
comment: In my opinion, this is the only place in Tampines with decent and reliably good ramen. The soup is flavourful without being too salty and the noodles are tangy and done al dente. I also love the soft boil egg that accompany the bowl of noodles.Should you prefer something other than ramen, they also have a good variety of curry rice, dons and side dishes. The dessert menu is small though so don't try to come here just for the dessert.The lunch menu is a steal at $11.80!

address: 2 Tampines Central 5 #B1-10/11 Century Square Singapore 529509 Singapore
comment: Location 4/5Conveniently located at basement 1 of Century Square mall, this is a new Japanese casual dining restaurant that took over from the previous Ramen restaurant. The restaurant has about 13 tables which can seat about 50 people. Ambience 3/5Mainly catering to the weekday office crowd, noise levels can be on the loud side. Service 3.5/5Customers are seated fairly quickly whenever tables are available. Customers then make their orders easily via an iPad that is stored in a slot under the table together with the hard copy menus. The kitchen takes some time to serve the orders, or some orders could have been missed out, resulting in a delay of more than 30mins even with a half filled restaurant. We had to ask for our drinks first even though it could have been served earlier. A slice of matcha adzuki cake was offered for the delay in serving the meal. Nice service recovery. Food 3.5/5The tonkatsu bento box lunch set came with finely shredded cabbage and sesame dressing which was nice, steamed white rice with black sesame seeds, deep fried pork pieces which was a bit dry and tough and the portions are inconsistent from another same order, and yellow pickles. A choice of drink is included in the lunch set. Value 4/5Weekday lunch set menu ($8.90) and big bento lunch set menu ($10.90) are value for money and should be a favourite for the office crowd. Not a bad place for a simple lunch. However, the service needs to be improved. Perhaps the staff needs more training or needs to get used to the processes. Will revisit again in the future.

address: 2 Tampines Central 5 #B1-10/11 Century Square Singapore 529509 Singapore
comment: I really love this place for their wonderful ramen. The broth is not as heavy as Musashi or Keisuke, and it works perfectly without coming off as bland or tasteless. So if you don't like how thick Musashi's soup is, you might just love this place.You also can choose what type of noodles you want. And there's also sets for two or four people at great prices.

address: Fu Chan Coffeeshop Blk 139, Tampines St 11 Tampines 521139 Singapore
comment: The beef don is fantastic value for money, and brings back memories of piping hot bowls of Yoshinoya on those cold nights in Japan (not the crappy local variety!)

address: 357-359 Bedok Road Tang Tea House - Hong Kong Cafe Singapore 469545 Singapore
comment: This is a review of a lunch with a colleague at Botak Jones Favorites in Simpang Bedok.First, this is not a stand-alone place.  It is combined with Tang Tea House - Hong Kong Cafe.  If you do not know this, you will probably not find it.  There are some very small signs that say Botak Jones but if you are not looking closely you would not see them.  tinyurl.com/alt7srpIt does make for one huge and varied menu though.  I was there to try Botak Jones though.  I didn't really look at the menu section for the other restaurant.The ambiance is a bit of a negative.  It is a little on the dirty side.  But I don't really mind a little dirt here and there.  Much of the outdoor seating is on a slight incline.  One row of the seating is along an edge.  I have to think some folks topple.  The main issue though is the persistent smell of rancid grease. This was very unpleasant.tinyurl.com/a2tzrsyThe service was ok.  They covered the basics.  There were some mistakes, but nothing egregious.  This was fundamental service with no frills and no chit-chat.The food ranged from relatively poor to relatively good.  Unfortunately, the good was my colleagues lunch.This is a photo of what their jumbo hot lime juice looks like.  tinyurl.com/amw8t68I had ordered cold lime juice.tinyurl.com/a52693gMini Burger with turkey bacon set - I had this for lunch.  The burger truly was mini.    The burger was cooked to a super well done.  This was basically similar quality to a small fast food hamburger but not as tasty as a McDonald's cheeseburger.I will give them that the condiments were fresh and crisp.  This was a step up from most fast food burgers. For the second time in two days, I had baked beans that were obviously straight out of a can.  There was actually nothing baked about these beans at all.  The fries were your normal crinkle cuts fries.  However, they had added a smoky and spicy seasoning to them.  This may have been overdone but it was a nice try and mixing it up a bit.tinyurl.com/bb4tw2qChicken Burger - Since the cheeseburger was so small, I ordered a chicken burger to help round out my meal.  This was more similar to a reconstituted chicken patty than ground chicken.  it was not very good.  I just took a couple of bites and left the remainder behind.tinyurl.com/at72qx9Salad with Salmon - This was my colleague's lunch.  This looked quite refreshing.  It was neatly presented.  For a lunch, there was a nice piece of fish.  My colleague seemed to think it was quite ok.tinyurl.com/ault7msOverall, I really can't recommend this place.  cross the street in Bedok Market, there are options with better food and better maintained seating areas.  I just didn't think my food was well prepared or made from premium ingredients.  The service was ok.  I did think there were some issues with cleanliness.

address: 311 New Upper Changi Road Bedok Mall #B1-40 Bedok 467360 Singapore
comment: It's a small well put together place, all the stuff they have be it Pho, Ban Mi, Noodles, Vermicelli etc.  is pretty good, not the best Vietnamese you will have but its the only one in the vicinity and a pretty competent one, the prices too are reasonable.

address: 311 New Upper Changi Road Bedok Mall #B1-40 Bedok 467360 Singapore
comment: Venue - 4/5 Conveniently located with modern ambience and atmosphere. Clean and well maintained which is always a plus as a food establishment. Service 4/5The staffs are nice and ready to help us with anything that we need. Food 2.5/5 Mediocre food with nothing special about it. The pho itself is meh (ordered the beef slices pho), lacking in something that I usually have when I have a pho in Californian cities or Philadelphia where all the Vietnamese cuisine concentrates. Even in Canada or Do An in Indonesia. The beef slices is tender and good, but everything is else is meh: can be eaten, but once is enough. The pork roll is... Nothing. It is there, being eaten, but I feel nothing at all. It is just something that you can eat. Overall 3/5I wonder if it is being adjusted to suit the palate in Singapore but I am pretty sure there will be other places with better pho in town or Vietnamese cuisine in this matter.

address: 311 New Upper Changi Road Bedok Mall #B1-40 Bedok 467360 Singapore
comment: Easy to find with its location within Bedok mall. Most time I am here, there is no crowd. Place your order at the counter and they will serve you when your order is ready. Food wise, I would say it's average. There are better Vietnamese food for sure else where.

1st time I tried dry bak kut teh and I'd say that I like it better than the regular 1 - it's tastier than the soupy bak kut teh, the fried cuttlefish + okra works very well by giving a crunchy, crispy texture to the dish which work great with piping hot rice. Get the braised tau kee whenever you go there too - it's crispy tofu skin braised with a little bit of sauce.

Started by an ex-offender to provide jobs to other ex-offenders. The bkt is a cross between our local Singaporean version and the Malaysian version. So they offer quite a few dry dishes and not just the traditional soup dishes. My favorite thing there is the dried beancurd skin in claypot.It is ok. I would go there if I live nearby but nothing to write home about.

address: 2 Tampines Central 5 #B1-25 Century Square Singapore 529509 Singapore
comment: Jack's Place is where you can get decent steaks. Over the years, they have added many other food items onto the menu. It is quite a popular choice for a family restaurant as they have different food items that can satisfy different preferences. The steaks are their signature and they've been doing it ever since the restaurant business started. You can either choose the steaks from U.S. or N.Z. Overall average food, average service, average everything.

address: 2 Tampines Central 5 #B1-25 Century Square Singapore 529509 Singapore
comment: The set lunch used to be value for money. I always order the rib eye steak. For the past 1 year, I find the size of the steak shrinking! I've stopped my membership and only come here once a blue moon. Very disappointing because the value is not there anymore.The lobster bisque quality fluctuates. Occasionally, it's diluted and watery.

address: 6 Changi Business Park Avenue 1 #01-37 Singapore 486017 Singapore
comment: We just went there a few hours ago and I was pissed. I was a big fan of theirs when they we're still known as "Calle Real" located around the marine parade area. They say they've rebranded & changed their name to "Comida Fiesta", but based on our last dining experience, it's hard to believe that these were the same friendly people.1: When we arrived, this pinay nanny who was looking after 2 girls told us straight up that they only served buffett even though we called them ahead of schedule and had them confirm that they had "a la carte" items on the menu. What appeared to be the manager later came to us and handed us the menu and motioned for us towards the tables. I might add, she looked like she hated her job. Very cold.2. When we asked whether they had wifi, the nanny again told us they were having problems connecting and mentioned that the 2 young girls she was looking after were using data on the phone they were watching youtube videos with. Undeterred, we asked the manager lady if they had wifi, turns out they did have it and gave us the details of the FREE WIFI. That nanny is starting to get on my nerves.3. We sat on the table and noticed that the saucer (for dips & chili sauce) was used. We motioned for the manager and she gave us a new one. We ordered 3 iced teas. The manager just gave us 3 canned drinks...that was it. No ice, no glasses..just the canned drinks. This is the first time I had to tell a restaurant manager how to run their restaurant. 4. Their seafood paella was horrible. It looked great at first, but when I pried open the crab claws, all the meat turned to dry powder. Mussels & shrimps were fine (thank God) but overall, I'm not going to order that dish again.5. The Brazo de Mercedes cake tasted like foam & cardboard. Before, they seem to just melt in the mouth. It felt like they changed the recipe or something. That or the slice has been sitting in the fridge for weeks.6. It seemed like there was going to be a big party that night at the resto and with the cold treatment we experienced there, we can't help but feel like they wanted us to get lost asap so that they can start decorating.Overall, our experience was ugly & we're not going back there. RIP Calle Real. You will be missed.

address: Blk 85 Bedok North St 4 Singapore 460085 Singapore
comment: My favorite go to hawker food center with all my Singaporean local favorite street food.  Definitely more local and cheaper than Newton Food Center where foreigners only know to go.

address: Blk 85 Bedok North St 4 Singapore 460085 Singapore
comment: If a local, non-touristy hawker center is what you're seeking, Bedok 85 is the place to come! The food here is delicious, a great value, and you know that the place is full of locals, since it's surrounded by nothing by housing complexes. On my nighttime visit, my favorite dish was a minced pork and pork meatball noodle soup, which had a clear, yet super flavorful broth and ramen-like noodles. We also had a delicious sambal stingray, full of spice and flavor! The stir-fried kangkong with sambal from the same stall made for a nice vegetable side. The oyster omelet with a spicy dipping sauce was a bit on the greasy side, but the barbecue chicken wings and chicken/pork/mutton satay were all delicious! All of the things we had were hawker classics, and everything came at great prices, according to our local Singaporean friends! This food center is definitely off the beaten path but worth the journey for a local experience!

address: Blk 85 Bedok North St 4 Singapore 460085 Singapore
comment: This is one of the many reasons why i love my country! Cheap supper!! Bedok 85 is a food centre that operates from day to night. Some stalls are opened in the day and some in the night. Well... Some food are not really meant to be a day food for us. Eg. Satay & bbq food? Anyway, i was here on a thursday night 11pm, parking and finding a seat is easy. If you intend to be here on wkends, be prepared to find yourself going rounds & rounds looking for carpark lots, seats & a long long wait for your food. This location is not near to MRT.I like the bbq chicken wings, minced meat noodles in soup & occassionally..Oyster omelette. The taste is rather inconsistent. As for which stall to order from... Just go for the longest q. Thats what most of us do! They sell similar stuff and price is stated clearly. Find a table, order, pay & wait.

address: Blk 85 Bedok North St 4 Singapore 460085 Singapore
comment: I can't believe that there isn't any entry yet of this temple of glorious food place on Yelp. Tucked in the neighbourhood of Bedok, it isn't exactly central but whatever time you drop by here, you're gonna see a crowd, whether is it 10am or 10pm. It's like a mini food Mecca because of the genuine-ness of how food is prepared here. The BBQ stalls here are trustworthy, try their chicken wings and you won't be let down! The main highlight here will be the two famous stalls side-by-side, selling soup Bak Chor Mee. With a rich soup stock, generous toppings of "floating" minced meat and chewy noodles, you are in for a treat! What most people's conundrum will be at first visit, is which stalls to choose from? Up till now, I don't have the answer but try both and see which you like best. They actually come from the same "family-syndicate". All in all, what I like is their authenticity of how they prepared the food. No diluted sugar cane juice, no bland soup and no food trying to be something that it's really not with artificiality. The awesome part is, I'm not even referring to any stalls in particular!

address: Blk 85 Bedok North St 4 Singapore 460085 Singapore
comment: The best market in Singapore. When you ask anyone the best bar chor Mee. It would definitely be Bedok 85 market. If you ask anyone the best BBQ stingray it would be Bedok 85 too. It has the best food of all varieties. You would definitely love the BBQ chicken, porridge at night, egg omelet and such. Delicious and cheap. Recommended for tourist too. Better than Lau pa sa

address: 162 Upper East Coast Road Singapore 455259 Singapore
comment: This is a review of a lunch with a colleague at Deli Turk Turkish Cuisine.  While going to a lunch at a nearby restaurant, I spotted Deli Turk.  After reading reviews, I suggested we visit and check it out.tinyurl.com/cs5sm5nFor our lunch, the restaurant was pretty much empty.  I do not even think there was one other party.The room is colourful with some art lending touches to the restaurant's Turkish and Mediterranean inspiration.  The space is clean and well-kept.tinyurl.com/cx8zxh4The server was friendly.  The meal moved along at a nice pace.  It was neither hurried nor were there noticeable delays.One key issue though was they were out of multiple dishes we ordered.  This included falafel.  A Turkish restaurant that is out of falafel?  He suggested replacing it with a bread.  At the time, I didn't really understand what he was suggesting.  We also ordered some calamari but were told they were out.The food ranged from average to very good.Sigara boregi (fetta cheese and Mediterranean parsley filled filo pastry rolls) - This was pretty much a Mediterranean version of a fried mozzarella stick.  It was crispy on the outside with oozing hot melted cheese on the inside.  It was quite good.  But I was surprised it didn't come with some type of dip.tinyurl.com/bwk3emlBread with hummus - This is the dish that was served as a replacement for falafel.  It was ok.  The bread was good but is certainly no substitution for falafel.  The hummus was nice with just the right amount of seasoning.Bread:tinyurl.com/dx92ry7Hummus:tinyurl.com/cydzmbeKarisik izgara tabagi (mixed grill)- This was a big platter of chicken, beef, and lamb.  I strongly preferred the meats that were whole cut over the ones that used minced meat.  These were all very tasty and tender.  I did not find the minced meats to my liking, neither the texture or the flavour worked for me.  The tomatoes were quite good.  They were sweet with no hint of bitterness.Out of the platter, the chicken was my absolute favourite.  I could have eaten 10 lbs of it.  This is a large platter and was quite a lunch for two people.  As part of a meal, it could certainly be significant enough for a group of four.tinyurl.com/be6pmmnReceipt (Lunch for two - $95.30):This is not a budget lunch.  We didn't hold back in the ordering though.  That being said, I do not think there are many alternatives on the menu for those that seek the sub $10 lunch.Overall - The food was pretty good.  While, on the basic side, the ambiance is nice with touches that provide some colour.  The space feels more like a lunch or casual dinner spot than the prices might suggest.  The service was friendly.  I do consider it a considerable negative to not have multiple items on the menu available.  This is especially true if one is a staple of the cuisine.  If you are in the mood for some Mediterranean styled meat, Deli Turk Turkish Cuisine.could do the trick.

address: 162 Upper East Coast Road Singapore 455259 Singapore
comment: The meats and salads were average but the dessert was excellent. What prompted the bad review was pretty much being unceremoniously kicked out by the owner. We arrived at 7 and were told that we had till 845, which we thought was plenty of time, but at 8, one of the staff must have realised he made a mistake and told us that the time was actually 8. So after having to rush through our dessert, we asked the server if there was any compensation for cutting our meal short. What we got was the owner coming in personally to tell us that we need to go and presented us with the bill. Average food, good dessert, horrible service and a very bad taste in my mouth after being kicked out for the establishment's error.

address: 162 Upper East Coast Road Singapore 455259 Singapore
comment: I have to be honest in that I am not a huge fan of Turkish food; in fact what I know about Turkish cuisine is embarrassingly only limited to generic kebabs sold in food courts. So when my friend suggested this restaurant for our dinner, I was rather apprehensive, but hoped for a pleasant surprise.We started off with the pita bread. The texture of the bread and very light and came nicely toasted. Not too bad, but I'm not easily impressed by bread. Next came our main courses; I had the adana kebab, which was basically spicy minced chicken that is grilled on a skewer. I found this was very tender and tasty, and probably one of the better kebabs I have eaten. The chicken went very well with the rice, especially with the grilled chili that came with it. Highly recommended. My friend had the lamb kebab which was also very nice according to him. Overall, I was very satisfied with my dining experience in this restaurant, and no doubt it has made me appreciate Turkish cuisine quite a bit more.

This is a review of lunch with a colleague at Sedap Corner.   Sedap Corner is kind of hidden away near the back of Bedok Market.tinyurl.com/bjj34vgSedap Corner is clean and neat.  It is a relatively basic and functional space.tinyurl.com/cjcx9kvThe staff was very friendly, polite, and effective.  The meal flowed at a good pace and the staff was consistently checking to insure things were going well.The food ranged from good to very good.  Their menu consists of a mix of southeast Asian dishes and Western standards.Crispy Potato wrapped prawns - These were tasty and they were tender. The sauce added just the right amount of sweet heat.tinyurl.com/b22wuddSaigon Rolls - These were well prepared.  They were crisp on the outside and stuffed with fresh vegetables on the inside.  That being said, there wasn't anything that made them standout from the many many other spring rolls I've eaten.  tinyurl.com/awgm7gwLime Juice - Their lime juice was another one that was a touch more bitter than I prefer.  Whether it is or not, I do not know.  However, it didn't really taste like a fresh lime juice.  But it was still pretty good.tinyurl.com/b2tozh2Chicken - This was a very flavourful chicken dish.  I also thought the fresh coriander was a nice touch.  It added some real freshness.  The only negatives were that some off the pieces of chicken were a little hard and the rice was a little pebbly.  As far as taste though, it was certainly a winner.tinyurl.com/acpmqauPad Thai - My colleague ordered the pad thai.  It was well presented and looked truly appetizing.  He enjoyed it, ate every bite, and said it was above average.tinyurl.com/a33crd3Overall - This is a basic place with very good service and flavourful, well presented food.  It is not a wow place for a important date but for a casual lunch, in my opinion, it is a very good option.

I was pleased with our meal.  I was nervous when our host said they have malay, american, thai, +++  cuisine on the menu.We all tried different cuisines and all were pleased.   The drinks were very good as well.

Opened by a celebrity chef, this café specializes in Malay cuisine with a twist of fusion in its food. The chef's specialties include dishes like Green Curry, Assam Fish, Prawns and Squid and Grilled Chicken, which are all halal. Compared to the other halal eateries along Simpang Bedok, Sedap Corner is a more upmarket bistro, with prices that are higher as well. There is a better and more comfortable atmosphere there though, complete with air-conditioning. Sedap Corner serves extraordinary dishes as well, like the Toast with Durian and Kaya dip. The durian does surprisingly go with the toast, making an enjoyable sweet snack. The offer unique beverages too, which are obviously their own creations. There are Sejati (Apple, Lemon, Strawberry and Soda) and Tioman Sunrise (Yoghurt, Mango and Soda) just to name a few.

One thing I really like about Fish & Co. is how consistent they are with their food. It is almost as if if you enjoyed this dish at a branch, you can be certain to enjoy the same dish at another branch too. I had their Japanese Fish & Chips which is described as "Fish & chips stuffed with furikake and mozzarella cheese for a crunchy twist, and topped with lemon butter sauce." Wasn't too sure how "Japanese" it was by taste except for the use of seaweed strips as garnish but I think it had a different batter from their regular fried fish. The mozzarella was pretty mild in this one too. I should've stuck to the regular New York Fish & Chips. I also additionally had their mussels in lemon butter sauce. I love LOVE their lemon butter sauce. Always be sure to ask for more on the side, they serve as a fantastic dip for your fries. Also rounded up my meal by sharing one of their huge Sharkie Freeze. I love indulgent food.

I've done fish & co before, and I know people scoff at it - as they do many of the chains - but hey, I like it.not so much this branch though, and here's why (hey, a list!):1. we were kept waiting in a queue while there were empty tables inside;2. numerous staff were walking about looking busy without never actually helping (manager included, and probably doing it best - in that she was worst);3. tables were cramped together so you had to hear your neighbor's conversations (and get dragged into their birthday song-singing). it's more than enough to make a person more schizophrenic.4. and the utensils came sticky (eew). and then they took them away, told us they had to wash the entire basket AND THERE WERE NONE LEFT IN THE STORE FOR US TO USE AT THAT MOMENT, and left us waiting with our rapidly-cooling food on the table.seriously, what?!but they were polite and so smiley at you, which I guess should make things better - it probably says something about me that I wish they were a little more hostile so I could kick up a fuss at how badly organised the place was.

address: 311 New Upper Changi Road #01-94 Bedok Mall Singapore 467360 Singapore
comment: Initially located at Bedok Central, the outlet not only relocated, but expanded itself into a café at Bedok Mall. I have to point out though that the aunties who work at the counter are one bunch of friendly folks. Hats off to them!They serve not only the standard soya milk, beancurds and pancakes at this place like most of their kiosks do, but many other soya-related meals that I unfortunately fail to recall. There were just too many varieties. I guess that's why this outlet is termed as one of their special dessert concept stores.The place had seats for about 4 groups of people.

address: 311 New Upper Changi Road #01-94 Bedok Mall Singapore 467360 Singapore
comment: Of all the Mr Bean, this is my favorite. They serve the usual drinks and bean curd. But what is more interesting are the desserts. Price is reasonable and service is good.

address: 51 Tampines Ave 4 #01-103, Our Tampines Hub Singapore 529544 Singapore
comment: The menu was much to be anticipated for. Nice menu with very appetizing looking foods. When the food arrived. I realized looks could be deceving. The food was dry. The dessert, brownie was dry. It wasn't even heated up. Definitely not coming here again.

I always love this place. Great place for Penang Food. It's a no frills, great food type of place. The food served are of a good standard, and everything is reasonably priced. At about $30 for 2 people, and you'll always walk out satisfied. And there are always promotions here to satisfy everyone. Now.. For a limited time, sign up for their mobile membership card and you can redeem a free signature Juice of the day for free!

I've been to two Penang culture outlets, and both did not impress me in the slightest.The food was average at best - basic hawker food that you can find for $5 outside, but with air-conditioning and for three times the price. They had a promo for "free signature juice" with $30 spend. The juice turned out to be... one cup of barley. For a $30 spend.Not only that, but they serve some cheap crackers at the start and charge you $2 for them. Unless you're a premium seafood restaurant, that's just cheap.

address: 1 Tampines Walk #B1-K24 Our Tampines Hub Singapore Singapore
comment: For the pricing and to grab a quick meal at the counter is doable.  My Late Lunch was OKAY.  Nothing to write about but maybe it was an isolated incident.  The Chips that they provide tasted stale.  May return and perhaps order some other items from their Menu.  Thankfully it is a Muslim Friendly eatery in this neighborhood aka OTH that I can get my craving fix for some "Turkish" wrap of some kind.

address: 58 New Upper Changi Road #01-151 Singapore 461058 Singapore
comment: It is served the same style as the famed soup minced pork noodles at fengshan block 85 market, except that this is served with wanton rather than pork balls.Garlicky soup, al dente noodles. I found the noodles to be thicker. Nonetheless, It is a good bowl of noodles, But it doesn't hit the spot like the one at Block 85. However, since block 85 only opens in the evening, if you have a carving for soup minced pork noodles in the dot, this may be the only place.Expect a wait of at least 20min on weekends.

address: 53 Upper East Coast Rd Singapore 455214 Singapore
comment: Pretty decent Japanese restaurant that serves the expected selection and it has yakitori too. Good selection of sake. Gets pretty crowded on weekends so do come early or book. Huge car park across the street and a petrol station too to top it up if you need .Awesome! Need not head to town for my yakitori fix. One thing.. would be good if they had melted proveron cheese on their yakitori selection

address: 53 Upper East Coast Rd Singapore 455214 Singapore
comment: The place is clean and minimal. Food is not too bad tasting but very below par for the prices that they are charging. At first glance, the food looks relatively affordable with most items priced at less than $5. We had their tofu topped with a century egg paste which at $6.90 was rather steep. Much more lean was the 1.5pieces of a mushroom that was put on a skewer for close to $3. Meat skewers were a slightly better option with prices ranging from $2 or $3 ( can't recall ) onwards per stick, but even then you would have to order quite a substantial number of sticks as portions are small. Much needs to be done to win repeat customers.Not recommended for families or those who want a lot of food on the meal table.

address: 1 Changi Business Park Crescent #02-17 Plaza 8 Singapore 486025 Singapore
comment: Sou's Noodle Restaurant is a basic dining establishment in Plaza 8.I've eaten lunch there twice.The staff is very friendly and helpful.  They do provide full table service.  On both visits, while the restaurant was busy, we were quickly seated.  Throughout my meals, the service was timely.   This included the preparation of our meals.The first time I visited Sou's, I left my phone on the table.  Soon after, I returned to the restaurant.  The staff quickly recognized me and asked if I was looking for my phone.  I was very happy to be reunited with my digital leash.Like many of the lunch focused eating establishments in Plaze 8, the ambiance is basic and functional.  It is clean.  But, the tables and chairs have seen better days.  tinyurl.com/8amn5a7The cooking is done in an open kitchen.tinyurl.com/9njac84While not extraordinary, the food I've eaten there has been consistently good.  The dishes my colleagues have eaten also look appetizing.I've tried two main dishes here.On my first visit, I had beef with noodles.  The beef cubes were large, tender, and flavourful.   I enjoyed the noodles also.tinyurl.com/8bd4ckhOn my second visit, I ordered the chicken curry with rice set menu.  This included the main, side of greens, and a soup.  It also included a lemon tea.The chicken curry is served in a bowl.  They provide a plate with rice.  I enjoyed this dish. It could use a little more pop though.   The flavour was a little monotonal.  But I certainly liked it.  I thought it was quite filling.tinyurl.com/8kc9n67tinyurl.com/8b2y9g6While I did not eat them all, I tasted the greens.  They were well-prepared.tinyurl.com/8gajspbI did not find the soup to my liking.  This was more due to personal tastes.  It seemed to be a simple fish or seafood stock.  The direct seafood flavour was stronger and more distinct than I prefer.tinyurl.com/8mt7h9pOn my second visit, my colleague ordered a mix of dim sum. tinyurl.com/9dycp2nOverall, if you are in the area, this is a good lunch option.  The service is friendly and prompt.  The room is comfortable enough.  While not earth-shattering, the food is well-prepared and enjoyable.  I would not hesitate to return.

address: 1 Changi Business Park Crescent #02-17 Plaza 8 Singapore 486025 Singapore
comment: very bad experience here, Service was very terrible, and bad .. they dont' even care their customers .. they were fighting and shouting with the customers for food left over (3 green dumplings which was tasteless, 3 sou mai which was not cooked and 1 udon noodle) and insist to have the $10 dollars surcharge...  (there were at least 5-7 paid adult on that table).They provide the steamboat food first, dim sum comes very late to save their cost. Food quality was very bad, in the middle of the bum is still cold, sou mai is tasteless .. not value for money .. Worst place to go ....

I've always enjoyed Malaysian wanton noodles. This restaurant that is part of a franchise does a pretty decent job. The fried wanton was quite good. Decently done. The soup wanton was a little too starchy and wasn't well cooked. They stucked together. Noodles nicely cook. In short, if you like a no fuss noodles meal, savory, and not too heavy, this chain restaurant will give you just that. ;)

address: 326 Bedok Rd Simpang Bedok Singapore 469496 Singapore
comment: This is a review of lunch with a colleague at Syed Restaurant at Bedok Market.I used a Google maps search plus some Yelp research to select Syed for lunch.The restaurant has a varied menu of Thai Muslim cuisine.   Plus, they offfer varied other dishes  However, some of this menu is reserved for dinner service.The service was a tad haphazard but it gets the job done.  This is more about getting your order taken and your food on the table than being cordial.  Do not expect any chit-chat or "how is your meal?".  Soon after we were seated, our order was taken.  My food came out quickly.  My colleague's dish took a little longer but I do not think it was more than a bit over ten minutes.  His second juice was also delayed.As with nearby Enak and Spize, the outdoor seating is clean and well-ventilated.  It is basic but relatively comfortable.tinyurl.com/c4v3kzrtinyurl.com/cpaw7xtThe food was good.First up, they also have the jumbo lime juice.  Woo hoo!  Lol, but jumbo was not even enough to quench my lime juice craving.  I ended up ordering a second regular sized one also.Jumbo Lime Juicetinyurl.com/c6ba6y5My colleage had their fresh squeezed orange juice.   He must have liked it because he also ordered a second juice.tinyurl.com/cukr6g4Roti John Keju Ayam - I thought this was very good.  It was almost pastry like.  Then there was the creaminess of the sauces.  I ordered it just to try it but with just a tad of help, it was finished.tinyurl.com/cpfpsmkKway Teow Goreng Chicken - This was my main.  I thought it was very good.  I ate every bite.  The flavours came together well and every once in awhile I would hit a little bit of Thai chili padi.  The noodles were cooked perfectly.   The pieces of chicken were tender.  It was definitely a freshly prepared dish.  While not huge, the portion did make for a good lunch.tinyurl.com/dxuh9guMee Hoon Goreng Mutton - This was my colleague's main.  While I didn't try it, the dish certainly  looked delicious.tinyurl.com/ceuvtt2Receipt ($23.90) - If I hadn't ordered an extra dish and we both had not ordered two juices, this would have easily been under $20 for the two of us.tinyurl.com/cow34auOverall - I think the thing that would make this Syed Restaurant a repeat is the food and to try some of the other menu items.  For outdoor (hawwker style) seating, the ambiance is nice, clean, and well-ventilated.  The service may not be perfect but it gets the job done.  I thought it was a very good lunch.

address: 326 Bedok Rd Simpang Bedok Singapore 469496 Singapore
comment: If you are looking for authentic Indian Muslim food, then Syed Restaurant is the place. It is the first stall along the stretch of halal eating places, and is located right at the entrance of Shop n Save supermarket. Personally, I prefer the Roti Prata and Maggi Goreng at Syed as compared to the others down the row.  Their Roti Pratas are always served fresh and crispy, unlike some stalls that cook them beforehand and serve them cold. Crispy on the outside and warm on the inside, their prata is best taken with fish curry. They have chicken curry and mutton curry too, and they will serve it at your request. Syed Restaurant serves a mean bandung too. I can never get the right taste from bandungs elsewhere, but the bandung here is neither too sweet nor too diluted. It is the perfect drink to take while you are eating prata too. Service is good, and the staff are warm and friendly, so it is a great supper place to go to.

address: 326 Bedok Rd Simpang Bedok Singapore 469496 Singapore
comment: Introduced a good many friends here. My Spanish friend & his parents loved the Murtabak here. I come here for the Teh Halia whenever I have a cold. The egg & cheese Roti Prata is great & so is their Ice Kopi. Their Nasi Campur has an inconsistent taste & is a tad bit greasy but their fresh stuff is great! It's open 24 hours & the food is very very very affordable. The service staff looks a tad bit disoriented always but they're well meaning guys if you manage to catch their attention to get you your food!

address: 2 Tampines Central 5 #01-44/47 Century Square Singapore 529509 Singapore
comment: Came on a friday night. Didnt have to wait too long to be seated.Tried the onion bomb and spicy dry noodles.If you are into spicy food, this is definitely a hit. Also tried the new soju drink, grapefruit flavoured which was pretty good too.

address: 2 Tampines Central 5 #01-44/47 Century Square Singapore 529509 Singapore
comment: Came here pretty late during lunch hour on a  Sunday but surprisingly I was seated rather quickly.The ambience in this place was pretty cosy and modern. More open concept dining area and the props they used were pretty neat.Did some research on what was in Tampines area and was excited to see that they have a branch here besides the one in Tanjong Pagar. As I was running late, I quickly browsed the menu and ordered Ganjang wings (soya sauce). Then ordered Sikhye (korean sweet rice drink) for beverage.Food came in less than 10 minutes and the portion was bigger than what I thought. For the price, it was considered quite affordable. The chicken skin was crunchy and the soya sauce mix on top of it had a taste of which you will crave for more. The chicken flesh was pretty juicy. It was definitely a well recommended dish here. I was surprised on how addictive the sauce mix was.The Sikhye came in a bigger portion for a good price too. They added lesser ice which was a plus as they did not want to minimize its taste.After the meal, you have to queue at the counter and pay for the meal. The servers were friendly and efficient. I also noticed that they served the others fast. Was definitely one of the best dining experiences I've ever had. I am glad that I chose this to try out for lunch :)

address: 2 Tampines Central 5 #01-44/47 Century Square Singapore 529509 Singapore
comment: Expensive. Not worth the prices. Cheaper elsewhere. Is chicken cooked differently in Korea? Meal for three cost almost $60 for normal looking food which I can get at hawker centers. So you end up paying for the ambience.

address: 2 Tampines Central 5 #01-44/47 Century Square Singapore 529509 Singapore
comment: This will be a fairly short review because I'm simply struck by how poor the service is. The breakdown of my review: one star is for the food being edible and the second is for it tasting pretty decent.In order of reasons to go to this place, I'd rank it as such: food, price, service. The food was the standard processed and/or frozen cheap ingredients that seems to be very popular among Korean restaurants. It is almost always saved by the marinade or dressing. Price is not cheap. The price of half a watermelon of juice (without soju) is 19 with service charge and get added. It is kind of absurd.Service was a joke from the start, and particularly, to the end. I understand being busy but we encountered pretty much every possible issue at billing including almost double billing us, charging us double the amount plus not giving us the promo price they'd told us about resulting in 4 times the amount being quoted, and then returning with the new bill less our credit card and telling us to produce the credit card to sign it. We deftly pointed out that they're still holding on to our credit card. By this point, our annoyance had ballooned to a full on rage; we could've probably powered a small hot air balloon. What didn't help was changing staff each time they return with the bill or tended to us, which is probably what resulted in so much confusion to begin with. In any case, I'd probably never return to this place until I receive confirmation that service has been greatly improved.

address: 2 Tampines Central 5 #01-44/47 Century Square Singapore 529509 Singapore
comment: Affordable my foot. I've got mixed feelings about Chicken-Up. Though the flavor and texture is there, it is an absolute rip off. It's good but not worth it. Very premium chicken wing, good value maybe not.
Small food court walking distance from the Bedok Reservoir Park. Has 2 Muslim food stalls, several Chinese options and a Western food stall. Has restrooms and a general store as well.

Average quality decent priceTypical Chinese restaurant serving typical Chinese food. Quality is average and service cannot be faulted. Nothing really stands out except the place is huge. Big halls where weddings dinners take place. Chinese New Year Reunion dinners happens every year and is almost always full. The main reason is the decent price decent quality food with lots of parking and definitely easy access at the Singapore Expo area.

address: 311 New Upper Changi Rd #B2-22 Singapore 467360 Singapore
comment: Great food @ affordable price!You can get a burrito/kebab/quesadilla/bowl with whatever you want for under 10 bucks.1 star off for not accepting credit/debit cards - NETS or cash only.

address: 311 New Upper Changi Rd #B2-22 Singapore 467360 Singapore
comment: Their food is pretty healthy and the price is affordable. I usually patronize at their Jurong Point branch. Once, while ordering my food, I heard the servers discussing amongst themselves about the freshness of the vegetables. That's when one of them mentioned that they are at least a day old. When I approached them and inquired further, they just laughed it out. 1. It's wrong to provide false information (it's mentioned on their website that all their products are fresh). 2. The owners/franchisees should well train and educate their servers. They shouldn't be discussing about the poor quality of the foods in front of the customers. It just tarnishes the brand image. 2 stars just for the taste of the food.

address: 311 New Upper Changi Rd #B2-22 Singapore 467360 Singapore
comment: I rarely write a review right after patronising the stall but this is worth an exception. There was nothing good to say about the place from its atrocious customer service and ineffective chain of production to the completely inauthentic and almost meatless burritos.Let's start from the beginning. It was my first time at stuff'd and as you can imagine, I was very clueless on the ordering process. This wasn't explained terribly clearly either. We tried to order 1 kebab and 3 burritos to take away, and this seemed to highly confuse the staff as there's only two of us. At the first person in the chain, we were instructed not to mention which meat we want to her. Service didn't get better. The worst was the fourth person (meat and toppings). I'd been asked if I wanted mash, which I'd said no, assuming that I could have any 5 toppings. I looked at the board carefully and realised I didn't actually have a choice of 5 toppings so I told her immediately that I'd like to have mash. She proceeded to turn to the girl next to her that wraps them up, and say extremely loudly that it's not that she didn't give me enough meat, it was my fault I'd ordered mash at the last minute. She repeated the fact that I'd changed my mind at least 3 times, loudly, while I stood in front of her in horror and embarrassment. She also proceeded to pack the last two with the same chicken and toppings without asking me what I wanted, because she was too busy making it clear to the other girl that I'd been fickle. I couldn't get a word in to tell her they're meant to be beef. By the time she was done and we had snapped out of our shock, the cashier had quickly keyed us in for chicken burritos and the damage was done. Plus point though, the service is extremely fast, but there was a lot of yelling going on and asking us to repeat our order because at each stage, they hadn't communicated that we'd ordered 4 items not 2.Foodwise, it was downright bizarre. Chicken was burnt, bitter and practically non-existent. Beef con carne had a bone in. My burrito had mash and corn as free toppings but guacamole and cheese were chargeable. The former two don't complement the burrito, and I've no idea where the idea for the toppings and sauces came from. I don't know much about genuine Mexican food, but it was definitely not tex-mex.After this horrid experience, I've vowed never to go back to Stuff'd, and I wouldn't recommend anyone else doing so.

address: 311 New Upper Changi Rd #B2-22 Singapore 467360 Singapore
comment: This may be the best kebab/Burrito I have ever eaten!  Been there every week for the chicken kebab with bbq and habenero sauce. Wow! Excellent food and service.
Lousy food, portions are poor and the clam chowder looks like straight from the cans. Not recommended. Really do Boston seafood label injustice.

rest_name: Rong Yi Hong Kong Dim Sum
comment: This is a fairly new joint that took over Lemongrass restaurant, and maintained the former's rather oppressive retro green facade. The interior is cramped and no frills, much like a typical HK dim sum place. That's where the similarity ends, which I should have realised when most of the waitstaff were mainland Chinese. Food picks were the usual, and weren't executed with much finesse. Everything was just meh- the chee cheong fun tasted mass produced, without the slippery silkiness that one associates with home made dim sum. Fried rice tasted like the sort that comes from a zi char stall, and the rice was definitely leftover, to the point of being hard. Century egg pork porridge was functional, and on the excessively thick side, the sort where your spoon could stand in it. Har gao was hard, with thick skin. Radish cake and mango bean curd rolls were normal. The xiao long bao was done Chinese style, as opposed to Taiwan style, which meant thicker skin and less soup. Golden sand bun wasn't too bad, though the bun was too thick. The only item I quite fancied was the black bean steamed pork rib, which was sufficiently tender and fatty. Price point wise, it's a bit on the steep side. 9 dishes and 2 drinks for 2 pax cost us almost $60 (on a side note, I roll my eyes at any place that charges $2 for canned drinks- blatant rip off in action); for a place that does only 1 dish well, it's pretty certain to say I won't be back again.

Food is decent. Had the masala thosai and it was a reasonable portion size, not massive but not tiny either and adequately filled. Dhall and coconut chutney were nice. Stall owner is standoffish to the point of being rude. No greeting, no thank you, no response to a thank you, he just turned around and went back to his prata flipping. Don't patronise if service standard is important to you. If it's not, the food isn't bad and they open till about midnight.

Rudest Owner of a Prata Shop I've ever met. Went there for breakfast with friends. Ordered 1 kosong, 1 egg and onion and 1 egg prata for 3 persons. First the cook (owner) shouted that we should go away and sit down. I tried to repeat the order but he rudely said "Sit down and I will call you."Then when I went to check after 10 minutes, he shouted again, "Go sit down - still one person before you". Finally after 15 minutes when I had already finished my noodles (ordered from another stall), I heard the ding-ding of his call bell. So went to pay and collect the pratas - he gave 2 plates - the kosong was stacked on the egg prata. I asked for another plate because there were 3 persons' orders and the cook shouted - kosong cannot have seperate plate. There was a stack of plates on the side - so I just helped myself to one extra plate - how does he expect 3 people to eat from 2 plates? Then he shouted - kosong must order 2 to get plate and curry - when I asked for 1 more bowl of curry - he only gave us 2 bowls at the time, he shouted extra curry 50 cents. My friend who ordered the kosong was embarrassed - she told me to just walk away - she will share one bowl of curry with her husband. I dug out 50 cents and gave it to the cook - who then reluctantly dished out another bowl of curry. This isn't the first time I've encountered the rudeness of this man - but I was "forced" into ordering from him because my friends wanted roti prata and chose the venue. If the owner had said we should order 2 kosongs minimum, all this could have been avoided. However, he chose instead to shout and make himself absolutely obnoxious, I wonder why he bothered to live at all! Another friend who swears by his prata and "friendliness" is an Ang moh and 6 foot tall. I can only imagine the prata man is a misogynistic pratt. (forgive the pun). So DON'T eat there if you are a woman.
I tried their chicken murtabak tonight. They did a good job of making the prata nicely golden brown without burning it, and it wasn't too oily.

address: 300 Tampines Ave 5 #01-02 Tampines Junction Singapore 520506 Singapore
comment: This review is mostly for the biryani rice not what they are famous for - Indian Rojak. Stopped for lunch and it is a ticket system. To go and eat here have separate numbering "queues".  Best if you decide on one or the other and not have both. The drink "stall" I side is a separate vendor and you pay separately for that. Biryani rice with lamb was ok. Rice is not as fragrant as I would have liked or tasted elsewhere. Too brown looking for me. Nice pice of meaty lamb that is tender so that saved the dish. A bit of cucumber salad accompanied the rice and meat and a side bowl of curry sauce completed it. Sauce was slight spicy. We ordered the rice for here and Rojak to go because we did not think we can eat all of them. We thought we can save them some washing.  By the time Rojak is ready, we were done with the rice. Rojak came in a plastic bag instead of a styrofoam box. I'm not sure which is better but for fried food I always feel it is better in a box with holes for venting. They were very generous with the sauce, also in plastic bag. Hot sauce in plastic bag did not appeal to me. Since we were eating some of the Rojak in the restaurant, we asked for a small bowl of sauce and they said No. if we had ordered Rojak for here, like the table next to us, it is unlimited refills on the sauce. Go figure the logic. We did the messy thing of opening up the sauce in the plastic bag and asking for a small sauce bowl to eat done if the good there. I tried the tofu and that was good. The rest was too much fried food for me. In summary - be prepared to wait. Eat there instead of taking out. The packaging will likely change the texture of the Rojak.

address: 300 Tampines Ave 5 #01-02 Tampines Junction Singapore 520506 Singapore
comment: PRICE: OKAY$4 each for the Mee Goreng & Nasi Goreng Ikan Bilis which is okay for me because the serving is quite large but there is no form of meat in the two dishes i ordered. Drinks are pricey. $2 for iced milo. ATMOSPHERE: OKAYA little cramp because the tables are very close to one another and there a couple of flies here and there but otherwise okay. FOOD: NOT BAD The portion was very filling and the food smelt really good & taste was great! Not alot of ingredients though, only vegetables, egg and the carbohydrate for the dish. No fancy seafood / meat / fish. OVERALL: OKAYMight come back if i feel like eating something different from what i usually eat. But the queue during lunch time is long so do be prepared to wait about 20min for your food!

address: 300 Tampines Ave 5 #01-02 Tampines Junction Singapore 520506 Singapore
comment: I was so hyped up when I reached the restaurant. Couldn't make up my mind but finally settled to takeaway Kway Teow Goreng and Mee Kuah.Minus points for counter staff because of attitude problems. Really, just because you claimed fame! I waited nearly half an hour and had to go up to them when the food was actually there for quite some time. Paid, left, went home & had the worst ever dinner! Seriously can't figure out what the Mee Kuah should taste like! It's like BLAH! Then can only taste the salt in the Kway Teow! ... Nuff said .. first & last time buying food fm there!

address: 10 Changi Business Park Central 2 #01-07, Hansapoint Singapore 486030 Singapore
comment: This is a review of a grab and go lunch from The Sandwich Shop (Hansapoint).This is a pretty straight-forward sandwich shop.  It is simply and clean.  But there were boxes, etc sitting around.tinyurl.com/cahxs9hThe staff is friendly but seem disorganized.They have sandwiches in a refrigerated area.   There were lots of people surrounding it.  So, you kind of have to work your way in and pick your sandwich..  I think they will heat sandwiches up.  I do not know if they make sandwiches to order or not.They have a very poor selection of drinks and chips.  There  was a lineup.  Everyone seemed to be lost.  It should be pretty simple.  But it  even for the people that just wanted to add a soup, this was confusing to the staff.  This led to the queue moving much more slowly than it should.Ham and  Brie Sandwich - For a pre-made sandwich this was pretty good.  It would have been better if the cheese had been warmed but, with the lineup, I was going to challenge fate and end up waiting much longer to get my sandwich heated.   the ham was tasty.  I enjoyed the roll.  The ingredients were fresh.tinyurl.com/d6z8n5kOverall - For grab 'n go, the quality of the sandwich was actually pretty good.  Teh challenge is the go part.  This should be super quick.  It simply wasn't.  Plus, they really need a wider range of beverages, chips, etc...  I can't say that I have a strong desire to go back.  I can walk across the street to Cedele and get a made to order sandwich in just a tad more time.  The Sandwich Shop just seemed to fall a little short of my expectation.

address: 5 Changi Business Park Central 1 #B1-12/13 Changi City Point Singapore 486038 Singapore
comment: Ichiban Sushi is really what I consider to be value for money. Compared to other sushi chains, Ichiban Sushi serves bigger servings, at a very competitive price. The food is not exceptionally tasty, pretty average I would say. But the variety of stuffs that is served here is definitely a plus! Other than the usual conveyor belt sushi, there's also interesting kids' menu, seasonal menu, as well as promotional menus! If you're constantly looking around for value eats and discounts, Ichiban Sushi will be more than happy to welcome you. Personally, I find that the taste of the food is not that authentic. Then again, it's really good enough, considering the little price you pay! Value price, good eat!

Super pricey desserts!Probably a high end ice kachang if you need a local comparison. A Korean ice shaving dessert.Multi-layered of texture, flavours, sweetness, from the outside in. A small cup of unsweetened condensed milk somehow make the layering acceptable.The $16 chocolate version. Has KitKat, pokka sticks, Ferraro Rocher chocolate balls in there. This one I am sure I can replicate at home.The Mango version is very creamy and sweet. Probably can kill a couple of diabetic patients, so stay away. LOLThe Matcha version is most impressive, and probably most interesting of all. We all like it.The Injeolmi, or mochi, version, is a little let down considering all the ones before. But I am sure some will find this agreeable to their palate.$68.60 is the total damage for four bingsu. So it's probably worth it if you had many good Instagram photos of them. Otherwise, it's not for teenagers, most teenagers anyways.
The food was delicious and tasty.The servers were nice.The environment was nice.Overall good meal.

Not to bad if you ask me. The restaurant serves a range of indonesian and thai dishes which are two of my favourite cuisines. I last ate there when they had their lunch promotion (im not sure if its still on going), and it was a pretty good meal. If i remember correctly, I had the green curry chicken and it came with one or two side dishes. I recall having the thai fishcake and fired fish which were decent additions to the meal.Its was an enjoyable experience!

The food wasn't good and took forever to be served. (drinks even came after the food) I ordered lime juice and I think they tried to trick me by giving me calamansi instead. Service was slow. Waited forever to be seated even though the premise wasn't at full house.

Food was fine. Service was terrible.  Employees are rude.  Waited 15 minutes and 3 request to get an unsweetened tea.  It finally came and was sweet.  Then the guy tells me they don't have unsweetened tea.   Not nice people.

Once or if we're lucky, twice every year we get to fly to the Food Paradise that is Singapore. This is one of our "go to" food centres when we're in Singapore.Usually the tell-tale sign of a good dish or chef is the lines out the front but I think some people just enjoy lining up for food at times in Singapore without their being any substance behind the food for my tastes.In actuality it's really hard to get a really bad satay anywhere in Singapore, these weren't the best but still very good. What makes this place different, is all the other good places to eat with in 10 seconds walking distance, which will give you more things to sample.It may take a little time to fine a seat at the Bedok Block 85 North complex where the food hall is situated but there is plenty to choose from whilst there and it's worth the wait. The Char Kway Teow and Oluak aka oyster omelette from the store next door are good, as is the two stalls around the corner that sit side by side to each other that serve Bak Chor Mee aka pork noodles. Just check out my other posts at Bedok Block 85 North for more information on the food available in the same complex.Cheers!Dave.

address: 207B New Upper Changi Rd #B2-42/43 Singapore 467345 Singapore
comment: I am thankful for Itacho at Bedok Mall. I was craving Japanese food and my parents introduced me to Itacho. Dad introduced me to the longest Unagi Nigiri ever!. It was a whole half an eel fillet on top of a small lump of nigiri. It was crazy wild and quite tasty.The chawan mushi or savory steamed egg custard with seafood was alright. I enjoyed the maguro and salmon nigiri sushi. Dad ate some kind of stewed fish. It was not my kind of thing, but he enjoyed it heartily with rice. The vegetable tempura was decent. They gave us lots of grated radish with the dipping sauce. I enjoyed my cold tea noodles or cha soba.Our server was fabulous. My parents know her by name, but I have forgotten it. This is why I need to take notes on my phone when I am dining. Overall, the meal was okay, but it hit the spot.

address: Blk 209 New Upper Changi Rd #01-633, Bedok Mall Singapore 470775 Singapore
comment: NOT MY FIRST TIME HERE PRICE: OKAY I bought cheese fries at $4 but overall the menu price is quite standard like any other fast food restaurant but the snacker boxes are always value for money!  FOOD: AWESOME My cheese fries today were really good. They were real hot even after waiting for about 10 min before i ate! The cheese was also nice and warm which is really good, the cheese is not always hot so really good today! Serving was a little small like it was not completely filled only about 4/5 of the way but its still okay for me. OVERALL: GOODjust a small snack review today but hope I'll be going there again soon to have a meal and write more reviews!

address: Blk 209 New Upper Changi Rd #01-633, Bedok Mall Singapore 470775 Singapore
comment: Have you tried their Grilled chicken?It's superb!!! Kind of remind me of the Pizza Hut's chicken wing, but the taste is so much more intense as they marinate and grilled whole chicken drumsticks.

address: 51 Changi Business Park Central 2 Lan Kwai Fong Food Mall Singapore 486066 Singapore
comment: I walked towards the stall not knowing what I wanted to eat.The uncle at the stall (who I presume is the owner), gave me a warm welcome and didn't rush me through my order (this is most important for me at any food stall).The dory fish looked nice to me. I asked if I could change the fries to something else. And he patiently told me that there was another dish with the fish and pasta or rice. At this point, I'm very impressed. At isual Singaporean food stalls, the person at the counter would be frowning at this point.I asked for penne pasta with it. He asked me what sauce I wanted. I asked for pepper on both the pasta and the fish. This is when most people would have given up on me and gone ahead with the order. But this guy told me that I should try a different sauce on my fish and my pasta. I ask for the original tomato and start looking away.He then asked me if I liked sweet, and I said I was okay with it. He insisted that I try "sweet" sauce on one half of the fish. I agreed because I really had no idea what to order. This was very unusual for any food establishment in Singapore. At this point, I was very impressed. I didn't care about the food.The food came and the fish was yummy, especially the half with the sweet teriyaki sauce. I loved it. I went back and thanked him for his recommendation. Will definitely go back to this place a few times at least.

address: 51 Changi Business Park Central 2 Lan Kwai Fong Food Mall Singapore 486066 Singapore
comment: This is a review of a quick carryout lunch from M2 Euro Asian Stall at Lan Kwai Fong Food Mall in the Signature Building of Changi Business Park.tinyurl.com/bxzxmprThe stall area is very clean and well kept.The stall attendant was extremely friendly and helpful.  He will happily communicate all of the different ordering options.  The food was prepped very quickly. tinyurl.com/cldrsw2The food was average.There are multiple options for the type of chicken, the sides, and the sauces.  Chicken:   Honey Baked, Baked Italian Pesto, or Pan FriedSides: Buttered Rice, Roast Potatoes, or Pasta (Penne/Spaghetti/Mac n Cheese)Sauces - Classic Tomato, Creamy Tomato, Creamy Mushroom, Pepper, or Teriyaki.There are other non-chicken menu options also tinyurl.com/cqmny6dHoney Baked Chicken - I selected this along with roasted potatoes and pasta.  I think I actually requested penne but was given spaghetti. This was not really an important factor for me.The piece of chicken was flavourful and the sweetness of the honey came through.  But it was a very small piece of chicken with very little meat.  However, the portion for the potatoes was generous and the portion for the spaghetti was very generous.  Each of these were very basic.  The pasta sauce was pretty much out of a tin or jar.  In the end though, it all made for decent lunch and it filled me up.tinyurl.com/crl47zeThe meal was very neatly packed into a resealable plastic container.  This container also did a good job of holding in the heat.  My meal remained warm.tinyurl.com/cea82tsThe price was just a touch over $7.Overall - The friendliness of the attendant and the relatively decent food makes Euro Asian Stall a potential return stop.  Frequently, I just need something basic and fast to get me refueled for the afternoon.  (Note: Lan Kwai Fong Food Mall recently opened as a replacement to the previous food court in the Signature building.  It is clean and bright.  During lunch, it can be quite busy.)

WAITING TIME: VERY LONG :/The salads & drinks came fast and then the first meal (aglio olio) came in about 7-10 min & but then the second meal (breaded chicken + fries) came after about 15-18 min & the longest was the third meal that only came after about 30 min after prompting the service staff. After our meal, we asked for the free scoop of icecream that came with the lunch set and after waiting for 10-15 min we called again with the staff and yet another 10-15 min waiting & it was long after the peak hour after so much waiting (came in at around 145pm & left at about 315pm) then after raising our hand for the 3rd time for about 5 min then a walking by staff saw us from another table and finally got our 3 scoops of icecream. HYGIENE: OKAYThe tables were wet with some yellowish brown stains when i used a piece of tissue to clean & some unknown liquid was dripping from the bottom of the table & there was a weird odour but the utensils looked clean.PRICE: NOT CHEAP3 set lunches cost us near $50 FOOD: NOT BADThe food were not bad even though the waiting time was really long. The spaghetti had flavour and the chicken was cooked well & the icecream was delicious. Also the proportions were good and filling not stingy.
